contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, some scattered showers are rolling through parts of the nation, but thankfully fine dust levels have eased due to this rain. What's the weather looking like at the moment?

Well, Conn-young. We're seeing some isolated showers in central regions including the capital, Jeollabuk-do and Gyeongsangbuk-do provinces. Most areas have only seen about 5 to 20 millimeters of rain, but we’re seeing some scattered thunderstorms. Most of the rain will stop by the end of the day, but in Jeollabuk-do and Chungcheong-do provinces, the rain will last until tomorrow morning.

We can expect warmer conditions, or even sweltering weather at times, as we go through the week. Daytime highs can get up as high as 28 degrees Celsius on Sunday. Wide temperature gaps of 10 degrees on average are expected for the week, so please make sure to take extra layers with you.

For tomorrow morning, Seoul will begin the day at 13 degrees, Daegu 16 and Busan 17.

Sunny spells are expected all across the nation in the daytime, with highs hovering around 24 to 27 degrees. Jeju will be a bit lower with 22 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see rainy spells for a second straight day, so for those in Japan's capital, make sure to grab an umbrella.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
5~20 mm of rain in store until dawn tomorrow... sunny and warm spells tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-26 17:03:51 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, it's forecast to be a rainy day for central parts of the country. Rain will begin from around lunch time so take an umbrella with you on your way out. Five to 20 millimeters of rain will fall until later tonight and we could also see some thunder and lightning.

Rain will keep central regions as breezy as yesterday with an expected high of 22 degrees Celsius, while southern regions will see bright skies all day with warmer highs at 28 degrees in Daegu.

Seoul will also see highs reaching 28 degrees by Sunday. The readings will get warmer as we head toward the weekend. Most areas will see sunny skies and it'll feel more like summer.

Speaking of which, this summer is forecast to be warmer than average with less rainfall.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Rain for central regions, sunny down south
Updated: 2020-05-26 06:01:20 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we've been seeing high levels of fine dust concentration along with some relatively cloudy spells in the capital. What's it looking like at the moment?

Well, Conn-young. Fine dust concentration levels are soaring in the Seoul metropolitan area now and parts of some inland regions are showing 'temporarily bad' levels. Layers of thick fog have also developed, so please be extra careful out on the roads tonight.

Rain is back in store for us. Starting from noon tomorrow, 5 to 20 mm of rain are expected in central regions, Gyeongsangbuk-do and Jeollabuk-do Provinces. This rain is expected to last until Wednesday morning and thunder and lightning may also follow, so please be aware.

As you can see, the weather will get warmer throughout the week. In the latter half of the week, daytime highs will soar to a scorching 28 degrees Celsius in the capital.

For tomorrow morning, Seoul will start off at 14 degrees, Gwangju 15 and Daegu 16.

Daytime highs will be similar to today's with Seoul at 22 degrees, Gwangju at 26 and Daegu at 27.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will have rainy spells tomorrow, so for those in the area, make sure to grab an umbrella.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Fine dust levels ‘bad’ in Seoul tonight, rain expected for tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-25 17:04:28 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. We had cool morning temperatures in most areas under lots of clouds, but it will turn warmer and sunnier by the afternoon. Highs will rise to the low to mid twenties, ranging from 21 to 26 degrees Celsius nationwide.

Along with the sunshine we are seeing, very strong UV rays will beam down on many inland regions. Don't forget your sunscreen and sunglasses during the day and drink plenty of water to stay hydrated.

This week, we'll notice the transition from late spring to more summer-like weather, highs jumping to the high 20's in Seoul by end of the week, shorter-term, we could see passing showers tomorrow afternoon into early Wednesday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

Morning temperatures in most areas are in the mid teens, clouds will be covering the skie, while Chungcheongbuk-do Province could see dust levels going up in the morning. Clouds will spread to most parts this morning

but by the afternoon mostly sunny skies will dominate so don't forget your sunscreen and sunglasses but on Jeju, it will be rather cloudy there all day. Highs will range from 21 to 26 degrees Celsius.

contents.headline:
Big temperature gaps, rise in highs under sunny skies
Updated: 2020-05-25 06:01:35 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we're getting close to the end of May and a summer heatwave is slowly approaching the peninsula. Daytime highs hit 25 degrees in the capital today. So tell us what's in store for us this weekend?

Well, Conn-young, this heat is forecasted to continue. But it will ease temporarily as some brief rainfall is in store for us tonight. Rain clouds have started to form again on the west coast. Showers are in forecast starting tonight until early tomorrow morning in the Seoul metropolitan area and Gangwon-do Province. There won't be much precipitationabout 5 to 10 mm, but there is a chance of thunder and lightning so please refrain from outdoor activities if possible.

After the brief showers, periodic clouds are expected for the weekend in the capital. On Sunday, rain is back in store for mid-western regions and in Jeollabuk-do Province.

For tomorrow morning, Seoul will start off warm at 15 degrees Celsius, Daegu at 12 and Busan at 14.

Daytime highs will be similar to today's with Seoul at 25 degrees, Daegu at 26 and Busan at 22.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo and Beijing will have rainy spells tomorrow, so for those in the area, make sure to grab an umbrella on your way out.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Rain of 5-10mm tonight in Seoul area, Gangwon-do Province
Updated: 2020-05-22 17:21:33 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, regions along the east coast will have relatively breezy highs again, hovering in the mid to upper teens. Those of us in western parts of the country will notice highs going a couple notches higher, reaching the mid twenties..

For a closer look, Seoul, Gwangju at 25 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju will be at 21 degrees this afternoon. It will be partly sunny during the day, but upper regions will dark rain clouds closing in by the evening.

Have an umbrella ready for your evening commute, That said, the rain will only be light -- 5 to 10 millimeters, and it should let up before the sun rises on Saturday.

Sunshine and warm readings return for Saturday, but Sunday looks to be a rainy one for the central region and Jeollabuk-do Province. Expect Sunday's rain to fall from dawn into afternoon.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
